provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. Tbese Regulations may be cited as the PubIic Accountancy Regu-
lations. 1970.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The Board shall, on or More the 1st day of October in each year.
submit to the Minister for approval its annual estimates of revenue and
expenditure.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3.41) TBe register d public accountants shalt stab, inter olio, in
respect of each registerad public accountant the following particulars-
     (a) registration number;
     (b) full name;
     (c) nationality:
     (d) date of regismtiat;
     (e) qualifications: under this heading shall appear the section of
          tbc Act under which tbe applicant qualifies for registration;
     (flresidential address;
     (g) professional address and the professional address so notified
          shall be deemed to be tbc registend address of such registered
          public accountant.
       (2) The Board shall keep an index to the register.
  4 4 1 ) Every person who wishes to have bis name entered in the
register shall submit to the Board-
     (a) an application on Form A of the Schedufa,                   sdlewa
                                                                     Pom A.
     (b) documentary evidence of his qualidcations foa registration;
     (c) an application fee of four dollars; and
                        THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS, 1970
                  (d) a registration fee of twenty-one dollars:
                         Provided that where the Board refuses to register the
                       applicant such registration fee shall be refunded to the appli-
                       cant.
                    (2) An applicant for registration shall furnish such other particu-
             lars as the Board may request in order that his name may be entered
             in the register.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5.-(1) Where an application for registration is accepted by the
             Board, the applicant's name shall be entered in the register and a
Form B       certificate of registration in Form B of the Schedule shall be issued
             to the applicant.
                    (2) If a certificate of registration is lost or destroyed, the person
             to whom it was issued may apply to the Board for a fresh certificate
             which shall be issued on payment by the appl~cantof a fee of tour
             dollars. A certificate issued under this paragraph shall be marked
             "Duplicate".

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-(1) Every registered student to w h ~ mthe provisions of sub-
             section (2) of section 12 of the Act apply shall notify the Board that
             he is such a student before the expiration of two years next after the
             date on which the professional accountancy body ol which he is such
             student is approved by the Minister pursuant to subsection (1) of
             section 12 of the Act.
                   (2) Every notification of a student's registration shall be
             accompanied by a fee of one dollar.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. Every registered public accountant shall notify the Registrar of
             every change of his residential or of his professional address.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. The Board shall on or before the 31st day of July in each year.
             publish in the Gazette the list of registered public accountants.
               SA.-(1) Every practising certificate issued under subsection (1) of
F   O   c.
         ~   section 146 of the Act, shall be in the form set out in Form C of the
             Schedule.
                   (2) Every practising certificate shall cease to be in force on the
             31st December next after its issue, unless it ceases to be in force
             woner, by virtue of the provisions of the Act.
                     (3) There shall be payable, in accordance with subsection (1)
             of section 1 4 o~f the Act, a fee of one hundred dollars in respect of the
             issue of each practising certificate.
             .-
                           IThe inclusion of this pape is authorized hy L.N. 86119851
         T H E PI/UL,IC ACCOI/.L'I'AiV'CY R E G O L A 1 I G 1 5 , 1WO

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. The Registrar shall-
    (a) remove from the register any name which the Board, acting
         under provisions of section 13 of the Act, directs him to
        remove;
    (b) re-register any name which the Board, acting under the pro-
        visions of section 13 of the Act, directs him to re-register;
    (c) correct in accordance with the Board's directions any entry
        in the register which the Eoard directs him in writing to
        correct, being in the opinion of the Board an entry which was
         incorrectly made;
    (4 remove from the register, in accordance with the Board's
         directions the name of a person who has died, or who, for a
         period of not less than two yews, has ceased to practise
         accountancy in Jamaica, or who, for a like period. has been
         absent from Jamaica;
    (e) make from time to time any necessary alterations in any of
         the particulars contained in the register;
    (f) make the appropriate note in the register when the Board,
         acting under the provisions of section 13 of the Act, suspends
         the registration of a public accountant.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10.-(1) Any person seeking to obtain the Minister's approval of
any body, experience, qualification or other matter for the purposes
of the Act shall address an application in writing to the Board, and
the Board shall forward such application, together with the Board's
recommendation, to the Minister :
  Provided that any accountancy body (othw than those specified in
the Third Schedule to the Act) seeking such approval shall pay a fee of
twenty-one dollars to cover the cost of investigation and such other
administrative expenses as may be incurred by the Board in connection
with such application.
        (2) Any recommendation to the Minister shall be by resolution
of the Board passed at a special meeting called for that purpose.

provisions.title: Section 11
provisions.content:
11. Any notice or document required by the Act or by these Regu-
lations to be given to or served on a registered public accountant shall
be deemed to be given or served by properly addressing, prepaying and
posting a letter containing the notice or document to the registered
address of such accountant, and, unless the contrary is proved, service
shall be deemed to have been effected at the tims at which the letter
would be delivered in the ordinary course of post.
              [The inclusion of this page is authori~edby L.N. 286/1976]
          THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS, 1970
                          PART11-DISCIPLINARY

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12. Where it is proved to the Board by the certificate of the com-
petent officer of the court in which the proceedings took place that a
registered public accountant has been convicted of a criminal offence
involving dishonesty, and that such conviction has not been quashed
on appeal, the Board may forthwith and without further enquiry direct
the Registrar to remove the name of such registered public accountant
from the register.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13.-(1) Where the Board receives a notification from the competent
officer of any professional accountancy body constituted outside
Jamaica that a registered public accountant has been deprived of, or
suspended from, membership of such professional accountancy body
as a result of disciplinary proceedings taken against him. the Board
shall forthwith direct the Registrar to inform such registered public
accountant by registered letter that the Board has received such noti-
fication and to invite him to show cause within such period as the
Board may allow why his name should not be removed from the
register or his registration should not be suspended, as the case may be.
          (2) Where-
     (a) no reply is received from the registered public accountant; or
     ( b ) the registered public accountant is unable to show cause as
            aforesaid.
the Board shall forthwith direct the Registrar to remove the name
of svch registered public accountant from the register or to suspend
his registration.
          (3) The action of the Board shall in due course be notified to
the professional accountancy body from which the notification of the
removal of the name from the register or the suspension was received.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-(1)     Where a complaint in writing, or information in writing,
is received by the Registrar from any body or person who alleges that
a registered public aecountant has procured any registration under the
Act as a result of a misleading, false or fraudulent representation, the
Registrar, after making such further enquiries relztive thereto as he
thinks necessary, shall report the facts to the Board.
           (2) The Registrar may, in relation to any registmed public
accountant, make to the Board a like complaint grounded on an
affidavit.
           (3) The Board may require the person or body making the
allegation to supply an affidavit stating the matters of fact on which
he relies in support of his allegation together with such further infor-
          THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS, 1970
mation or documents relating to the allegation as the Board considers
necessary.

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15. Where a complaint in writing, or information in writing, is
received by the Registrar from any person or body who alleges that a
registered public accountant has committed in the performance of his
professional duties-
     (a) an act of professional misconduct, or of grave impropriety,
          or infamous conduct; or
     (b) an act of gross negligence or of gross incapacity; or
     (c) an act which constitutes conduct discreditable to the profes-
          sion,
the Registrar, after making such further enquiries relative thereto as
he thinks necessary, shall report the matter to the Board.

provisions.title: Section 16
provisions.content:
16.-(1) Where the Registrar makes a complaint or reports to thz
Board that a complaint or information pursuant to regulation 14 or 15
has been received in respect of a registered public accountant, the
Board shall direct the Registrar to write to such accountant-
    (a) notifying him of the receipt of the compldint or information.
        and indicating the matters which appear to raise a question
         whether the registered public accountant has procured his
         registration as a result of a misleading or fra~dulentrepresen-
         tation, or has committed professional misconduct;
    (b) forwarding a copy of any affidavit or other document selating
         to the allegation;
    (c) inviting the registered public accountant to submit to the
         Board any explanation which he may have to offer;
    (d informing the registered public accountant of the date of the
         meeting of the Board at which his explanation, if any, will
         be considered.
        (2) The documents (including the explanation, if any, of the
registered public accountant) shall be referred to the Board at the
meeting held on the specified date.

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. In any case in which the Board, having considered the allegations
and the explanation, if any, of the registered public accountant, is of
the opinion that no priml facie case is shown, or that the allegations
appear to be frivolous or vexatious, the Registrar shall so inform the
complainant and the registered public accountant in such terms as
the Board may direct.

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18. In any case in which the Board, having considered the allega-
tions and the explanation, if any, of the registered public accountant,
-
              [The inclusion of this pngc is authcri~cdby L.N. 286/1'>76]
8             THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS, 1970
    is of the opinion that a prima facie case is shown, the Board shall fix
    a day for the holding of an enquiry.
              PART111-PROCEEDINGSAT DISCIPLINARY       ENQUIRY

provisions.title: Section 19
provisions.content:
19. In this part of the Regulations "President" means the President
    of the Board.

provisions.title: Section 20
provisions.content:
20.-(1) When the Board has fixed a day for the holding of an
    enquiry, the Registratr shall forthwith serve on the registered public
    accountant a notice in writing which shall-
        (a) specify the nature and particulars of the charge or charges
             against him;
        (b) state the date, time and place at which the enquiry will be held.
            (2) The enquiry shall be fixed for a date not less than twenty-
    one days firom the date of the notice.
            (3) The notice may be delivered personally to the registered
    public accountant or may be sent by prepaid registered post to his
    registered address.
            (4) A copy of such notice shall be sent to the complainant
    and to such other persons as the Board may direct.

provisions.title: Section 21
provisions.content:
21. Any party to an enquiry may be represented at the hearing by
    counsel or a solicitor :
      Provided that if any party intends to be so represented not less than
    seven days' notice in writing of such intention shall be given to the
    Registrar.

provisions.title: Section 22
provisions.content:
22.-(1) The complainant and the registered public accountant shall
    furnish to the Registrar and to each other not less than fourteen days
    before the day of the hearing a list of all documents on which they
    respectively propose to rely.
             (2) Either party may inspect the documents included in the
    list furnished by the other; and a copy of any document mentioned
    in the list of either party shall, on the application and at the expense
    of the party requiring it, be furnished to that party by the other within
    three days after the receipt of the application.

provisions.title: Section 23
provisions.content:
23. Where before the hearing it appears to the President or at any
    stage of the hearing it appears to the Board that a notice of enquiry
    or charge requires amendment, the President or the Board, as the case
    may be, shall give to the Registrar such directions for the amendment
    of the notice or the charge as they may think necessary unless, having
    regard to all the circumstances, such amendments cannot be made
    without injustice.
                  [The inclusion of this page is authorimd by L.N. 286/1776]
          THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATlONS, 1970

provisions.title: Section 24
provisions.content:
24.-41) Where it appears to the President or to the Eoard that it
is expedient whethm or not as a result of the exercise of the powers
conferred by regulation 23, that the hearing should be postponed or
adjourned, the President or the Board may give to the Registrar such
directions in that behalf as appear necessary.
       (2) Where the hearing is postponed or adjourned-
    (a) the Registrar shall forthwith give notice of the postponement
          or adjournment to every party;
    ( b ) where the postponement or adjournment is to a date to be
          determined, on the determination of the date on which the
          hearing is to be held or continued, the Registrar shall forth-
          with give notice of that date to every party.

provisions.title: Section 25
provisions.content:
25. If either or both parties fail to appear either personally or by
a representative, the Board may, if it thinks fit, and on being satisfied
as to the service of the notice of enquiry, proceed with the hearing.

provisions.title: Section 26
provisions.content:
26. At the hearing, the complainant or his representative shall first
state to the Board the charge alleged against the registered public
accountant and shall submit the evidence in support of the charge and
may call witnesses; and the registered public accountant or his repre-
sentative shall be entitled to cross-examine any witnesses appearing
against him on matters relevant to the charge.

provisions.title: Section 27
provisions.content:
27. When the statement of the charge and the evidence in support
thereof are concluded, the registered public accountant or his rcprescn-
tative shall be invited by the President to adduce evidence in answer
to the charge and to call witnesses, and the mmplainant or his represen-
tative shall be entitled to cross-cxamine any witnesscs giving cvidence
for the registered public accountant on matters rclevunt to the charge.

provisions.title: Section 28
provisions.content:
28. Whether the registered public accounlant adduccs evidence in
answer to the charge or not, he or his rcprcsenlal~vemay addrcs thc
Board and, where evidence is adduced. such addrcss rn,i> bc rnndc cithcr
before or after such evidence.

provisions.title: Section 29
provisions.content:
29. At the close of the casc for ihe ~egihtsred public account;:nt the
complainant or his represcnt:ltive may, with thc lcavc of the Board.
adduce evidence to rebut any cvidence adiluccd by the rcgi:;lercd public
accountant; and, if he does so. the rcgis1crc.d public accountant or his
representative may np~ri n ac!dres:; I he Roard.
               1Thc ~ n c l u ? i o nof 1hi5 pa:<,   i~ :~ulhnri/cxl h!. 1 . N . 41 1q7hJ
          THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS, I970

provisions.title: Section 30
provisions.content:
30. The complainant or his representative may reply upon the whole
case-
     (0) if oral evidence (not being evidence as to character) other than
          that of the registered public accountant himself has been
          given on such registered public accountant's behalf; or
     (b) w ~ t hthe leave of the Board, where no such evidence has been
          given.

provisions.title: Section 31
provisions.content:
31.-(1) Notes of the proceedings shall be taken by the Registrar
or other parson appointed by t!le Board for the purpose; and any party
who appeared at the hearing shall bc e n t i ~ l ~tod inspect the original or
a copy thereof.
       (2) Every person entitled to be heard upon an appeal against the
findings of the Board shall be entitled to a copy of such notes on pay-
ment of the charges from time to time prescribed by the Minister.

provisions.title: Section 32
provisions.content:
32.-(1) On the conclusion of the proceedings the Board shall
consider and determine as respects each charge which, if any, of the
facts alleged in the charge have been proved to its satisfaction.
        (2) If the Board determines in respect of any charge either that
none of the facts alleged in the charge has been proved to its satis-
faction, or that such facts as have been proved would be insufficient to
support a finding of professional misconduct. the Board shall record
a finding that the registered public accountant is not guilty of such
misconduct in respect of the matters to which that charge relates.
        (3) If the Board determines in respect of any charge that the
facts or some of the facts alleged in the charge have been proved to its
satisfaction and that the facts so proved are sufficient to constitute
professional misconduct, the Board shall record a fmding that the regis-
tered public accountant is guilty of professional misconduct.

provisions.title: Section 33
provisions.content:
33.-(1) If the Board records a finding that the registered public
accountant is guilty of professional misconduct, then before considering
and determining which of the disciplinary powers conferred by the
Act will be exercised, the Board may invite the registered public
accountant or his representative to address the Board on any mitigating
circumstances.
        (2) Thereaftex the Board shall consider and determine which of
the disciplinary powers conferred by the Act it will exercise and shall
pronounce its decision.
          THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS. 1970
        (3) The Board shall hold all disciplinary enquiries in private.
but shall pronounce its findings and decisions in public.

provisions.title: Section 34
provisions.content:
34.-(1) The Registrar shall forthwith notify the registered public
accountsint by registered letter of the decision of the Board.
        (2) Where a registered public accountant is a member of the
Institute or of a professional accountancy body constituted outside
Jamaica, the Registrar shall forthwith notify the Institute or such pro-
fessional accountancy body of the removal of his name from the register
or of the suspension of his registration.

provisions.title: Section 35
provisions.content:
35. Upon the holding of an enquiry the Board may, without finding
any misconduct proved against the registcred public accountant, never-
theless order him to pay the costs of the proceedings if, having regard
to his conduct and to all the circumstances of the case, it seems just to
the Board so to do.

provisions.title: Section 36
provisions.content:
36. If two or more registered public accountants are involved in any
charge or charges, the Board may hold separate enquiries or may hold
one enquiry in respect of all such registered public accountants and
may give directions as to the order in which proceedings shall be taken
in relation to each such registered public accountant.

provisions.title: Section 37
provisions.content:
37.-(1) Where the name of a registetred public accountant has been
removed from the register, any application for re-registration shall be
made in writing addressed to !he h a r d and signed by the applicant.
stating the grounds on which the application is made, and shall be
accompanied by the application fee of four dollars.
        (2) The application shall contain the names and addresses of
three or more persons able and wdllng to identify the applicant and give
evidence as to his characw. 'lad the nature of his employment since the
date of the removal of h ~ suamc from th:: register. and such other
evidence as the Board may rcqulre.
         (3) Not less than two of !he pcrsons mcntioncd in paragraph (2)
shall belong to one or more of the following categories, namely-
     (a) Justices of thc Peace;
     ( 6 ) ministers of religion;
     (c) registcrcd public accountants,
                -.       -.             -- - ....-.            -
                                                       .---. . - .. .- .
                                                                       . -      -    -.-
                                                                                    .-     ....   - --
              [The inclu\bnn of tlii,   p.lgt.   i' dll:tiori 14 I ) ) 1 U   ?%~"')l~il
           THE PUBLIC ACCOUNTANCY REGULATIONS, i970
so, however, that at least one shall be a registered public accountant.
       (4) The Board may require the applicant to verify by a statu*
tory declaration any statement made in his application. or any further
statement which it may think necessary, and may, if it thinks fit, require
the applicant to attend in person at a meeting of the Board at which the
matter is to be considered.

provisions.title: Section 38
provisions.content:
38. If Up6n consideration of the application and of the evidence
furnished in suppoat of it, the Board is satisfied that the application
should be re-registered, it may direct the Registrar accordingly, and.
upon payment by the applicant bf the registration fee, his name shall be
restored to the register and a new certificate of registration shall be
issued to him.
